questions.question_text:
A company uses AWS security services and tools. The company needs a service to help manage the security alerts and must organize the alerts into a single dashboard.

Which AWS service should the company use to meet these requirements?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Correct answer is D

Selected Answer: D
D. AWS Security Hub: Centrally view and manage security alerts and automate security checks

Selected Answer: D
D. AWS Security Hub

Selected Answer: D
D. AWS Security Hub

AWS Security Hub is a comprehensive security service that provides a centralized view of security alerts and compliance status across multiple AWS accounts. It aggregates findings from various AWS security services, including Amazon GuardDuty, Amazon Inspector, and Amazon Macie, as well as integrated third-party security solutions. Security Hub consolidates these findings into a single dashboard, making it easier for organizations to monitor and manage their overall security posture.

Selected Answer: D
D. AWS Security Hub

Selected Answer: D
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/securityhub/latest/userguide/what-is-securityhub.html
Selected Answer: D

Correct Answer is D
https://aws.amazon.com/security-hub/
AWS Security Hub is a cloud security posture management service that automates best practice checks, aggregates alerts, and supports automated remediation.

questions.question_text:
A company wants to run its workloads in the AWS Cloud effectively, reduce management overhead, and improve processes.

Which AWS Well-Architected Framework pillar represents these requirements?

A company uses Amazon S3 to store records that can contain personally identifiable information (PII). The company wants a solution that can monitor all S3 buckets for PII and immediately alert staff about vulnerabilities.

Which AWS service will meet these requirements?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
PII = Sensitive Data. Amazon Macie identifies Sensitive Data.

comments.content: yeah, I regret that I paid contributor access

Selected Answer: C
C. It is Artifact.

Selected Answer: C

Selected Answer: C
correct answer C

choices.C: Download the IAM credential report, then provide the report to the auditor.
choices.B: Take a screenshot of each user's page in the AWS Management Console, then provide the screenshots to the auditor.
choices.A: Create an IAM user account for the auditor, granting the auditor administrator permissions.
choices.D: Download the AWS Trusted Advisor report, then provide the report to the auditor.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Download the IAM credential report, then provide the report to the auditor.

The simplest way to provide an external auditor with a list of all IAM users, including the status of users' credentials and access keys, is:

C. Download the IAM credential report, then provide the report to the auditor.

The IAM credential report is a feature within AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) that provides a way to audit the status of credentials for all IAM users in an AWS account. It includes information about when each user's credentials were last used, the status of multi-factor authentication (MFA), and the status of access keys. This report can be generated and downloaded as a CSV file, making it easy to share with auditors or for compliance purposes.

Selected Answer: C
C. Download the IAM credential report, then provide the report to the auditor.
I am little surprise the default answer is B. lol

Selected Answer: C
C. Download the IAM credential report, then provide the report to the auditor.

Selected Answer: C
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/id_credentials_getting-report.html
Getting credential reports (console)
You can use the AWS Management Console to download a credential report as a comma-separated values (CSV) file. To download a credential report (console) Sign in to the AWS Management Console and open the IAM console at https://console.aws.amazon.com/iam/.
In the navigation pane, choose Credential report. Choose Download Report.

questions.question_text:
An external auditor has requested that a company provide a list of all its IAM users, including the status of users' credentials and access keys.

What is the SIMPLEST way to provide this information?
